StormR 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Compute product on given points coordinates for given storms

    stormBehaviour_pt.Rd

    This function computes products for each storm of a Storms object among TS (time series of wind speed), Power Dissipation Index and Category exposure for each given points provided in points input

    stormBehaviour_pt(
  sts,
  points,
  product = "TS",
  wind_threshold = c(18, 33, 42, 49, 58, 70),
  method = "Willoughby",
  asymmetry = "Boose01",
  empirical_rmw = FALSE,
  time_res = 1
)

    Arguments

    sts

    Storms object

    points

    data.frame. Contains longitude/latitude coordinates within column names "lon" and "lat".

    product

    character. Product to compute that is either

    • "MSW", Maximum Sustained Wind

    • "PDI", Power Dissipation Index

    • "Exposure", hours spent for each and all categories together

    Default value is set to "MSW"

    wind_threshold

    numeric vector. Wind threshold

    method

    character. Cyclonic model used to compute product, that is either

    • "Willoughby"

    • "Holland"

    Default value is set to "Willoughby"

    asymmetry

    character. Indicates which version of asymmetry to use in the computations, that is either

    • "None", no asymmetry

    • "Boose01", first version

    Default value is set to "None".

    empirical_rmw

    logical. Whether to compute the Radius of Maximum Wind empirically, according to getRmw function or using the Radius of Maximum Wind from the observations. Default value is set to FALSE

    time_res

    numeric. Time discretization (hours) used to compute the analytic raster(s). Allowed values are 1 (60min), 0.75 (45min), 0.5 (30min), and 0.25 (15min). Default value is set to 1

    Value

    Computed product for each points are returned through a named list. Each slot is named after the storm and has dimensions:

    • (number of observations:number of point coordinates), if product == "MSW". Correspond in fact of time series of wind speed on every observations (real and interpolated)

    • (1:number of point coordinates), if product == "PDI"

    • (6:number of point coordinates), if product == "Exposure"

    Contents
